text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Comprehensive physical rehabilitation services" means:
A program of coordinated, integrated, interdisciplinary, physician-directed services provided by or under the supervision of physicians qualified or experienced in rehabilitation that:
Includes evaluation and treatment of individuals with physical disabilities;
Emphasizes education and training of individuals with disabilities; and
Incorporates:
At least 4 of the following core disciplines:
At least 2 of the following disciplines:
Any other service that the Secretary may designate by regulation.

"Comprehensive rehabilitation facility" means:
Any person that provides or holds himself out as providing comprehensive physical rehabilitation services on an out-patient basis; or
A hospital that is licensed as a special rehabilitation hospital under Subtitle 3 of this title.

section.section: "Health care facility" includes any facility defined in § 19-114(d) of this title.
"Health care facility" does not include a home health agency that is licensed under Subtitle 4 of this title.

text.section:
"Specialized rehabilitation program" means any of the specialty programs that the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities accredits, including:
Spinal cord injury programs;
Head injury programs; and
Infant and early childhood developmental programs.
